channel.title: Syndicate 639 Development
channel.description:
[center] [img]http://puu.sh/3IbsX.png[/img]
[url=http://www.syndicate639.com/]Website[/url] | [url=http://www.youtube.com/user/SyndicateRSPS]YouTube[/url][/center]
Well, I've been working on this for the past month, and I have around another 3 weeks planned development time before I would like to start to advertise.
Suprise, suprise, it's a 639 Dementhium, but I want the features to be something people have never seen before. Some concepts may be familiar, but the way I do them are all from scratch.
[COLOR=red][i]All criticism and/or negativity is [b]WELCOME[/b], otherwise how else would we improve?[/i][/COLOR]
[SIZE=5][B][COLOR=maroon]Notable Features[/COLOR][/B][/SIZE]
[ul][li]Spawn server (items cost coins to spawn)[/li] [li]Kill streak system with perks[/li] [li]Achievements[/li] [li]Earn PK Points corresponding to the amount of damage you do per fight[/li] [li]Exchange the PKP for Tokens, which can be spent on the best items, or traded between players[/li] [li]No items are "donator only", everyone has an equal chance in the Wilderness[/li] [li]Completely new concept to Castle Wars[/li] [li]Fullscreen and HD compatible[/li] [li]Every major weapon, special attack, magic spell and equipment effect works as expected[/li] [li]Tz-Tok-Jad can be found in the Wilderness for a challenging aspect to getting fire capes[/li] [li]Fully automated donation system with 1 month and 6 month countdowns[/li] [li]Ever expanding statistics menu[/li] [li]Cheapest subscription and donation prices around[/li][/ul]
[i][SIZE=1]Membership days countdown.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/395ye[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Dying to Jad as I kill him.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/396fq.png[/img]
[SIZE=5][B][COLOR=maroon]How It Works[/COLOR][/B][/SIZE] Players will be able to spawn most items and supplies with their coins they start with. Killing other players will result in PKP correpsonding to the amount of damage you manage to do in that fight, and it would be wise to collect your loot to use or sell for more coins.
[i][SIZE=1]Demonstrating that item spawning costs coins.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/395UI.png[/img]
If you can kill people without dying, you earn certain perks for certain milestones. Currently the kill streak perks are for 3, 5, 7, 10, 12, 15, 20 and 25 kills in a row.
[i][SIZE=1]Kill messages have been reduced to 2-3 lines as opposed to 5.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/332a4[/img]
[SIZE=5][B][COLOR=maroon]Castle Wars Minigame[/COLOR][/B][/SIZE]
[i][SIZE=1]Up a tier for a kill, down a tier for a death. The Castle Wars Minigame.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/38yUY[/img]
If you have ever played "Gun Game" on Call of Duty Black OPs, you will understand the concept immediately. Basically, you enter the minigame (empty inventory and equipment) and you will be given a bronze dagger, already equipped. It's kill or be killed.
For every player you kill, you go up a tier. For every player that kills you, you go down a tier. There are 21 tiers in total and for each tier you go up, you obtain a better weapon.
[ul][li][b]Tier 1:[/b] bronze dagger[/li] [li][b]Tier 2:[/b] steel mace[/li] [li][b]Tier 3:[/b] mithril warhammer[/li] [li][b]Tier 4:[/b] rune scimitar[/li] [li][b]Tier 5:[/b] magic shortbow and 1000 rune arrows[/li] [li][b]Tier 6:[/b] granite maul[/li] [li][b]Tier 7:[/b] dragon dagger (s)[/li] [li][b]Tier 8:[/b] dragon scimitar[/li] [li][b]Tier 9:[/b] torag's hammers[/li] [li][b]Tier 10:[/b] dharok's greataxe[/li] [li][b]Tier 11:[/b] abyssal whip[/li] [li][b]Tier 12:[/b] crystal bow[/li] [li][b]Tier 13:[/b] dark bow and 1000 dragon arrows[/li] [li][b]Tier 14:[/b] 1000 ice barrages[/li] [li][b]Tier 15:[/b] rune crossbow and 1000 dragon bolts (e)[/li] [li][b]Tier 16:[/b] armadyl godsword[/li] [li][b]Tier 17:[/b] chaotic rapier[/li] [li][b]Tier 18:[/b] chaotic longsword[/li] [li][b]Tier 18:[/b] chaotic maul[/li] [li][b]Tier 20:[/b] vesta longsword[/li] [li][b]Tier 21:[/b] dragon claws[/li][/ul]
If you manage to kill someone on the last tier, you will win 25m for that costly spawning and a mysterious box for some unique equipment unobtainable else where. [SIZE=1][COLOR="#696969"]Okay, it's void pieces.[/COLOR][/SIZE]
[SIZE=5][B][COLOR=maroon]Achievements[/COLOR][/B][/SIZE] [b]Achievement:[/b] First Steps [i]Description:[/i] [ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must walk or run for the first time in the world of PK Syndicate.[/li][/ul]
[b]Achievement:[/b] Respect Your Elders [i]Description:[/i] [ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must kill a player in the Wilderness that is of a higher level than you.[/li][/ul]
[b]Achievement:[/b] Die Hard [i]Description:[/i] [ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must kill a player, and only have 100 or less hitpoints remaining.[/li][/ul]
[b]Achievement:[/b] Castle Wars [i]Description:[/i] [ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must complete all 21 tiers of the Castle Wars game.[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=5][B][COLOR=maroon]Other Media and Information[/COLOR][/B][/SIZE] [i][SIZE=1]Statistics book.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39AlV.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Everyone gets a random look and colour upon login, only players with membership can change their looks again.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39A1P.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Exchanging PK Points for tokens to spend in the PKP shop.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39BKP.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Current items obtainable from the PKP shop. The price in coins corresponds to the price in tokens.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39Bum.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Wrath in action. Death has since been removed until Halloween.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39KJT.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Korasi spec hits your maximum melee hit, but is a magic attack? M'kay.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39KOz.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Freeze![/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39KSu.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Armadyl godsword special attack.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39KW6.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Players with membership can restore their prayer, health and special attack, as opposed to only restoring prayer for free players.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39KXJ.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Give 'em the finger.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39L8o.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Rushing since '89.[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39LcX.png[/img]
[i][SIZE=1]Danger ahead, well, when someone logs in...[/SIZE][/i] [img]http://puu.sh/39LiH.png[/img]
[COLOR=red][i]More features and content to come, still under construction.[/i][/COLOR]

item.title: Syndicate 639 Development
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

I have decided to put the development into an alpha state, as it is in a playable state but there has been no where near enough testing before moving on to a beta and then an official release. Alpha and beta both plan to be short but sufficient lengths of time, because I don’t want to be stuck on “development” status forever.

Read full topic

item.title: Syndicate 639 Development
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Hope to see some implemented.

Read full topic

item.title: Syndicate 639 Development
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:10, topic:520924”]Take a good look at this code, it can be helpful:

package com.rs2.model.players.content.ranking.perks;

import com.rs2.model.players.Client;
import com.rs2.net.PacketSender;

/**
 * Handles the perks info interface from the ::perksinfo and ::perksinfo2
 * <code>Commands</code>.
 * 
 * @author Arham 4
 * 
 */
public class PerksInfoInterface {

	public static void perkInterface(PacketSender packetSender, Client client) {
		packetSender
				.openInterface(
						client,
						"@red@Perks",
						"@yel@Perks @bla@are very helpful in the midst of battle. You can dish",
						"out a perk at anytime and bring a tragedy to your enemy.",
						"But, if you do not know what your perks do, then how",
						"will you get a big advantage against your enemy? Read",
						"this guide to know what all the perks do.",
						"",
						"@gre@Regular Perks",
						"---",
						"@yel@Regular perks @bla@can be activated upon recieving PK Points.",
						"They have special characteristics that make them unique",
						"in their own ways. Regular Perks can cost from 2 - 28",
						"PK Points.",
						"",
						"@blu@Perk name - PK Points needed - What it does",
						"@red@Marathon @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@2 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Allows",
						"@gre@you to run with unlimited energy until you die.",
						"@red@Sleight of Hand @bla@ - PK Points needed: @gre@5 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Allows you to attack a bit more faster.",
						"@red@Scavenger @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@6 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Gives",
						"@gre@more food in loot from PvP.",
						"@red@Bling @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@8 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Makes a",
						"@gre@chance for you to stun the enemy and sharply decrease",
						"@gre@the enemy's Attack skill. If not, your Attack skill decreases",
						"@gre@slightly temporarily.",
						"@red@One Man Army @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@10 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Increases your Strength skill slightly temporarily.",
						"@red@Stopping Power @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@12 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Increases your Strength skill sharply temporarily.",
						"@red@Lightweight @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@14 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Gives you the ability to run faster until you die.",
						"@red@Hardline @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@15 @bla@- What it does: @gre@All",
						"@gre@perks require 1 less PK Points until you die. When you die,",
						"@gre@the next @yel@Death Perk @gre@will require 1 less death.",
						"@red@Cold Blooded @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@16 @bla@- What it does: @gre@All",
						"@gre@earth and water spells do half the damage until the user",
						"@gre@dies.",
						"@red@Danger Close @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@18 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Range and Magic attacks do 1/4 more damage until",
						"@gre@the user dies.",
						"@red@Commando @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@20 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Melee",
						"@gre@damage does 1/4 more until you die.",
						"@red@Steady Aim @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@21 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Range damage increased by 1/4 until you die twice.",
						"@red@Scrambler @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@22 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Increases the damage of daggers by 1/2 until you die.",
						"@red@Ninja @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@24 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Longswords",
						"@gre@and scimitars do 1/4 more damage until you die.",
						"Please type ::perksinfo2 for the rest of the information.");
	}

	public static void perkInterface2(PacketSender packetSender, Client client) {
		packetSender
				.openInterface(
						client,
						"@red@Perks",
						"This is a continuation of ::perksinfo.",
						"@red@SitRep @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@25 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Restore",
						"@gre@energy 2x faster.",
						"@red@Last Stand @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@28 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Increase your Defense skill slightly temporarily.",
						"",
						"@red@Death Perks",
						"---",
						"@yel@Death Perks @bla@can be activated by dying a lot of times in",
						"a row and not killing anyone. Death Perks differ from",
						"Regular Perks as you must use them in cronological order,",
						"not like in Regular Perks where you can use any perk you",
						"wish. Death Perks can be very helpful in revenge attacks.",
						"please note that Death Perks' deathstreaks increase only",
						"from PvP.",
						"",
						"@blu@Perk name - Deathstreak needed - What it does",
						"@red@Copycat @bla@- Deathstreak needed: @red@4 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Teleport to your killers location.",
						"@red@Painkiller @bla@- Deathstreak needed: @red@3 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Deals 1/4 the damage done to kill you back at your killer",
						"@gre@at death.",
						"@red@Martrydom @bla@- Deathstreak needed: @red@4 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Deals 1/2 the damage done to kill you back at your killer",
						"@gre@at death.",
						"@red@Final Stand @bla@- Deathstreak needed: @red@4 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Arrows damage you 1/4 of the damage they should. @red@BOLTS",
						"@red@STILL DO FULL DAMAGE.");
	}
}

Its my info tab for perks. Try to implement the ideas in the perks please.[/quote]

Wow, some great ideas there. Thank you for that, I had run dry.

Read full topic

item.title: Syndicate 639 Development
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Take a good look at this code, it can be helpful:

						"@red@Bling @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@8 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Makes a",

						"@red@One Man Army @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@10 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Increases your Strength skill slightly temporarily.",
						"@red@Stopping Power @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@12 @bla@- What it does:",

						"@red@Lightweight @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@14 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Gives you the ability to run faster until you die.",
						"@red@Hardline @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@15 @bla@- What it does: @gre@All",
						"@gre@perks require 1 less PK Points until you die. When you die,",
						"@gre@the next @yel@Death Perk @gre@will require 1 less death.",
						"@red@Cold Blooded @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@16 @bla@- What it does: @gre@All",
						"@gre@earth and water spells do half the damage until the user",
						"@gre@dies.",
						"@red@Danger Close @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@18 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Range and Magic attacks do 1/4 more damage until",
						"@gre@the user dies.",
						"@red@Commando @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@20 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Melee",
						"@gre@damage does 1/4 more until you die.",
						"@red@Steady Aim @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@21 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Range damage increased by 1/4 until you die twice.",
						"@red@Scrambler @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@22 @bla@- What it does:",
						"@gre@Increases the damage of daggers by 1/2 until you die.",
						"@red@Ninja @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@24 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Longswords",
						"@gre@and scimitars do 1/4 more damage until you die.",
						"Please type ::perksinfo2 for the rest of the information.");
	}

	public static void perkInterface2(PacketSender packetSender, Client client) {
		packetSender
				.openInterface(
						client,
						"@red@Perks",
						"This is a continuation of ::perksinfo.",
						"@red@SitRep @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@25 @bla@- What it does: @gre@Restore",
						"@gre@energy 2x faster.",
						"@red@Last Stand @bla@- PK Points needed: @gre@28 @bla@- What it does:",

						"",
						"@red@Death Perks",
						"---",
						"@yel@Death Perks @bla@can be activated by dying a lot of times in",
						"a row and not killing anyone. Death Perks differ from",
						"Regular Perks as you must use them in cronological order,",

						"wish. Death Perks can be very helpful in revenge attacks.",
						"please note that Death Perks' deathstreaks increase only",

						"",
						"@blu@Perk name - Deathstreak needed - What it does",

						"@red@Martrydom @bla@- Deathstreak needed: @red@4 @bla@- What it does:",

Its my info tab for perks. Try to implement the ideas in the perks please.

item.title: Syndicate 639 Development
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:3, topic:520924”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=639433.msg4309740#msg4309740 date=1370547136]
I like the overall concept good luck!
[/quote]As do I. The concept of this seems pretty nice, but it also seems like one that could fail miserably if it’s not designed correctly. Good luck.[/quote]

I agree, which is why I decided to create a project thread now to get any feed back I could.

[quote=“Flame_, post:4, topic:520924”]Your ‘Respect Your Elders’ achievement is sort of ironic when you see that to achieve the award you must kill someone higher than you.
Good luck.[/quote]

Yeah. That was kind of the idea.

Bump for the weekend. Working all weekend so will be buying a website and doing that on Monday. Will be thinking of new ideas whilst I’m working. I know I need something pretty big to stand out, and that’s what I am aiming for.

Read full topic

item.title: Syndicate 639 Development
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

[center]

Website | YouTube[/center]

Well, I’ve been working on this for the past month, and I have around another 3 weeks planned development time before I would like to start to advertise.

Suprise, suprise, it’s a 639 Dementhium, but I want the features to be something people have never seen before. Some concepts may be familiar, but the way I do them are all from scratch.

[COLOR=red]All criticism and/or negativity is WELCOME, otherwise how else would we improve?[/COLOR]

[SIZE=5][COLOR=maroon]Notable Features[/COLOR][/SIZE]

[ul][li]Spawn server (items cost coins to spawn)[/li]
[li]Kill streak system with perks[/li]
[li]Achievements[/li]
[li]Earn PK Points corresponding to the amount of damage you do per fight[/li]
[li]Exchange the PKP for Tokens, which can be spent on the best items, or traded between players[/li]
[li]No items are “donator only”, everyone has an equal chance in the Wilderness[/li]
[li]Completely new concept to Castle Wars[/li]
[li]Fullscreen and HD compatible[/li]
[li]Every major weapon, special attack, magic spell and equipment effect works as expected[/li]
[li]Tz-Tok-Jad can be found in the Wilderness for a challenging aspect to getting fire capes[/li]
[li]Fully automated donation system with 1 month and 6 month countdowns[/li]
[li]Ever expanding statistics menu[/li]
[li]Cheapest subscription and donation prices around[/li][/ul]

[SIZE=1]Membership days countdown.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Dying to Jad as I kill him.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=5][COLOR=maroon]How It Works[/COLOR][/SIZE]
Players will be able to spawn most items and supplies with their coins they start with. Killing other players will result in PKP correpsonding to the amount of damage you manage to do in that fight, and it would be wise to collect your loot to use or sell for more coins.

[SIZE=1]Demonstrating that item spawning costs coins.[/SIZE]

If you can kill people without dying, you earn certain perks for certain milestones. Currently the kill streak perks are for 3, 5, 7, 10, 12, 15, 20 and 25 kills in a row.

[SIZE=1]Kill messages have been reduced to 2-3 lines as opposed to 5.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=5][COLOR=maroon]Castle Wars Minigame[/COLOR][/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Up a tier for a kill, down a tier for a death. The Castle Wars Minigame.[/SIZE]

If you have ever played “Gun Game” on Call of Duty Black OPs, you will understand the concept immediately. Basically, you enter the minigame (empty inventory and equipment) and you will be given a bronze dagger, already equipped. It’s kill or be killed.

For every player you kill, you go up a tier. For every player that kills you, you go down a tier. There are 21 tiers in total and for each tier you go up, you obtain a better weapon.

[ul][li]Tier 1: bronze dagger[/li]
[li]Tier 2: steel mace[/li]
[li]Tier 3: mithril warhammer[/li]
[li]Tier 4: rune scimitar[/li]
[li]Tier 5: magic shortbow and 1000 rune arrows[/li]
[li]Tier 6: granite maul[/li]
[li]Tier 7: dragon dagger (s)[/li]
[li]Tier 8: dragon scimitar[/li]
[li]Tier 9: torag’s hammers[/li]
[li]Tier 10: dharok’s greataxe[/li]
[li]Tier 11: abyssal whip[/li]
[li]Tier 12: crystal bow[/li]
[li]Tier 13: dark bow and 1000 dragon arrows[/li]
[li]Tier 14: 1000 ice barrages[/li]
[li]Tier 15: rune crossbow and 1000 dragon bolts (e)[/li]
[li]Tier 16: armadyl godsword[/li]
[li]Tier 17: chaotic rapier[/li]
[li]Tier 18: chaotic longsword[/li]
[li]Tier 18: chaotic maul[/li]
[li]Tier 20: vesta longsword[/li]
[li]Tier 21: dragon claws[/li][/ul]

If you manage to kill someone on the last tier, you will win 25m for that costly spawning and a mysterious box for some unique equipment unobtainable else where. [SIZE=1][COLOR="#696969"]Okay, it’s void pieces.[/COLOR][/SIZE]

[SIZE=5][COLOR=maroon]Achievements[/COLOR][/SIZE]
Achievement: First Steps
Description:
[ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must walk or run for the first time in the world of PK Syndicate.[/li][/ul]

Achievement: Respect Your Elders
Description:
[ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must kill a player in the Wilderness that is of a higher level than you.[/li][/ul]

Achievement: Die Hard
Description:
[ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must kill a player, and only have 100 or less hitpoints remaining.[/li][/ul]

Achievement: Castle Wars
Description:
[ul][li]To complete this achievement, you must complete all 21 tiers of the Castle Wars game.[/li][/ul]

[SIZE=5][COLOR=maroon]Other Media and Information[/COLOR][/SIZE]
[SIZE=1]Statistics book.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Everyone gets a random look and colour upon login, only players with membership can change their looks again.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Exchanging PK Points for tokens to spend in the PKP shop.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Current items obtainable from the PKP shop. The price in coins corresponds to the price in tokens.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Wrath in action. Death has since been removed until Halloween.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Korasi spec hits your maximum melee hit, but is a magic attack? M’kay.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Freeze![/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Armadyl godsword special attack.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Players with membership can restore their prayer, health and special attack, as opposed to only restoring prayer for free players.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Give 'em the finger.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=1]Rushing since '89.[/SIZE]
